planning_goals.title: Architecture Guardrails
planning_goals.copilot_prompt:
Crew-7 Architecture Guardrails — Premium Edition

1) Enforce a clean 3-layer architecture: React/Next.js on the frontend, FastAPI/Python on the backend, and Docker + Infra as a dedicated layer. No UI code leaks into backend; no backend logic leaks into UI.

2) Every module must be modular, coherent, and purposeful. No God-files. The system should read like a well-orchestrated crew: crews, runs, traces, events, tools, marketplace, secrets, billing.

3) Public API must remain stable. When upgrading or refactoring, always introduce new versions instead of breaking old ones. No unexpected breaking changes.

4) Observability is a first-class citizen. Every agent action, event, tool call, lifecycle transition, and API request must leave a trace. Logs must have timestamps, IDs, and types.

5) The agent communication architecture must follow the Hybrid Model: orchestrator-led decision-making with direct specialist-to-specialist exchanges where efficient. The backend event system must reflect this clearly.

6) All execution must happen inside safe, resource-limited sandboxes. Timeouts, RAM caps, CPU limits, and restricted networking must be applied consistently.

Copilot: All architectural changes must be incremental, reversible, and follow these guardrails strictly. Reject suggestions that introduce coupling, performance risks, or unsafe execution paths.

planning_goals.title: MVP Focus Reminder
planning_goals.copilot_prompt:
Crew-7 MVP Blueprint — Focus & Boundaries

The MVP must deliver a clean, unforgettable first loop:
1) User selects or installs a crew → writes a mission → runs it → sees real-time output → views the Agent Graph → inspects traces.
2) No feature may slow down or complicate this main loop.

MVP Inclusions:
- Marketplace (install crew templates)
- Crew configuration
- Chat mode with real-time streaming
- Advanced Mode with Agent Graph
- Trace viewer (minimal but functional)
- Secure tool sandboxing

MVP Exclusions (Phase 2):
- Full Web3 integration
- NFT crew ownership model
- Tokenomics / payments / renting crews
- Complex billing engine
- Multi-run orchestration
- Deep crew editing studio

Design Priorities:
- Fast, intuitive interactions
- Responsiveness over heavy animations
- Stability over cosmetic features

Copilot: If a feature risks impacting timeline, performance, or the core loop, downgrade it to a placeholder or separate ticket.

planning_goals.title: Delivery & Timeline Guardrails
planning_goals.copilot_prompt:
Crew-7 Delivery Timeline — Guardrails for Speed & Quality

1) Every task must map to one of the Crew-7 pillars:
   - Run Engine
   - Agent Graph (Advanced Mode)
   - Marketplace
   - Dashboard
   - Blueprint Landing Page

2) Tasks must be small, atomic, and completable in 1–2 work sessions. Large tasks must be split.

3) No developer should remain blocked for more than 4 hours. If blocked, escalate immediately.

4) No new feature can enter a sprint unless it clearly supports:
   - Crew execution reliability
   - Graph accuracy
   - Marketplace install flow
   - User onboarding experience

5) Advanced animations, blueprint effects, and deep polish should only be integrated after core UX works end-to-end.

6) Copilot must always propose the simplest practical implementation. No over-engineering or speculative complexity.

Copilot: When generating or modifying tasks, ensure they respect timeline expectations, map to a pillar, and avoid scope expansion.
